oai_dc:dc.dc:title: East Tennessee Missionary Society. 1824
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: East Tennessee Missionary Society
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Concise Narrative of the Rise and Progress of the East Tennessee Missionary Society. May 21, 1824. Printed for the Society. Knoxville Register Office. Printed by Heiskell & Brown. 1824. Rev. Samuel G. Ramsey, President; Rev. Isaac Anderson, Secretary; and Mr. Hugh Martin, Treasurer. This rare publication includes several references to Mr. George M. Erskine, a former slave and an East Tennessee free man of color by 1824. Mr. Erskine was the second ordained free African American minister in the United States.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Missionaries; Presbyterian churches; Pamphlets; Clergy; African Americans;
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: C 353.97685 No. 12 in Volume I of Miscellaneous Pamphlets
